page.title: 04HOME LIFE/HOUSING EGMANTON
page.content: Most of the houses in the three villages date from the 18th and 19th century and are brick built. Some replacement of property with modern homes has been permitted although there have been no modern estate developments. Council houses are found in Egmanton and Laxton. In Egmanton 10 council houses in Gaddick View are well built and maintained. Curiosities in the villages include a timber built bungalow, a stone house and several derelict properties. Manor houses have gone from both villages and in Laxton the most imposing house is the Old Vicarage. A large neo-Georgian house is the most noticable residence in Egmanton. Many generations of the same families still live within the village. Newcomers are accepted and contribute much to village life.
